trans-unit.source: Logs, exceptions and custom diagnostics for ASP.NET in Application Insights
trans-unit.target: Logs, exceptions and custom diagnostics for ASP.NET in Application Insights

trans-unit.source: Diagnose issues in ASP.NET web apps by searching requests, exceptions and logs generated with Trace, NLog, or Log4Net.
trans-unit.target: Diagnose issues in ASP.NET web apps by searching requests, exceptions and logs generated with Trace, NLog, or Log4Net.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title> includes a powerful <linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> tool that enables you to explore and drill in to telemetry sent by the Application Insights SDK from your application.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title> includes a powerful <linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> tool that enables you to explore and drill in to telemetry sent by the Application Insights SDK from your application.

trans-unit.source: Many events such as user page views are automatically sent by the SDK.
trans-unit.target: Many events such as user page views are automatically sent by the SDK.

trans-unit.source: You can also write code to send custom events, exception reports, and traces.
trans-unit.target: You can also write code to send custom events, exception reports, and traces.

trans-unit.source: And if you already use a logging framework such as log4J, log4net, NLog, or System.Diagnostics.Trace, you can capture those logs and include them in the search.
trans-unit.target: And if you already use a logging framework such as log4J, log4net, NLog, or System.Diagnostics.Trace, you can capture those logs and include them in the search.

trans-unit.source: This makes it easy to correlate log traces with user actions, exceptions and other events.
trans-unit.target: This makes it easy to correlate log traces with user actions, exceptions and other events.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't yet <linkText>set up Application Insights for your project[start]</linkText><title></title>, do that now.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't yet <linkText>set up Application Insights for your project[start]</linkText><title></title>, do that now.

trans-unit.source: When you run your application, it will send some telemetry that will show up in Diagnostic Search, including requests received by the server, page views logged at the client, and uncaught exceptions.
trans-unit.target: When you run your application, it will send some telemetry that will show up in Diagnostic Search, including requests received by the server, page views logged at the client, and uncaught exceptions.

trans-unit.source: Open Diagnostic Search to see the telemetry that the SDK automatically sends.
trans-unit.target: Open Diagnostic Search to see the telemetry that the SDK automatically sends.

trans-unit.source: The details vary from one application type to another.
trans-unit.target: The details vary from one application type to another.

trans-unit.source: You can click through any individual event to get more detail.
trans-unit.target: You can click through any individual event to get more detail.

trans-unit.source: Custom events show up both in <linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> and in <linkText>Metric Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Custom events show up both in <linkText>Diagnostic Search[diagnostic]</linkText><title></title> and in <linkText>Metric Explorer[metrics]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can send them from devices, web pages and server applications.
trans-unit.target: You can send them from devices, web pages and server applications.

trans-unit.source: They can be used both for diagnostic purposes and to <linkText>understand usage patterns[track]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: They can be used both for diagnostic purposes and to <linkText>understand usage patterns[track]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: A custom event has a name, and can also carry properties that you can filter on, together with numeric measurements.
trans-unit.target: A custom event has a name, and can also carry properties that you can filter on, together with numeric measurements.

trans-unit.source: JavaScript at client
trans-unit.target: JavaScript at client

trans-unit.source: C# at server
trans-unit.target: C# at server

trans-unit.source: VB at server
trans-unit.target: VB at server

trans-unit.source: Open Diagnostic Search.
trans-unit.target: Open Diagnostic Search.

trans-unit.source: Select Custom Event and select a particular event name.
trans-unit.target: Select Custom Event and select a particular event name.

trans-unit.source: Filter the data more by entering a search term on a property value.
trans-unit.target: Filter the data more by entering a search term on a property value.

trans-unit.source: Drill into an individual event to see its detailed properties.
trans-unit.target: Drill into an individual event to see its detailed properties.

trans-unit.source: Page view telemetry is sent by the trackPageView() call in <linkText>the JavaScript snippet you insert in your web pages[usage]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Page view telemetry is sent by the trackPageView() call in <linkText>the JavaScript snippet you insert in your web pages[usage]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Its main purpose is to contribute to the counts of page views that you see on the overview page.
trans-unit.target: Its main purpose is to contribute to the counts of page views that you see on the overview page.

trans-unit.source: Usually it is called once in each HTML page, but you can insert more calls - for example, if you have a single-page app and you want to log a new page whenever the user gets more data.
trans-unit.target: Usually it is called once in each HTML page, but you can insert more calls - for example, if you have a single-page app and you want to log a new page whenever the user gets more data.

trans-unit.source: It's sometimes useful to attach properties that you can use as filters in diagnostic search:
trans-unit.target: It's sometimes useful to attach properties that you can use as filters in diagnostic search:

trans-unit.source: Trace telemetry is code that you insert specifically to create diagnostic logs.
trans-unit.target: Trace telemetry is code that you insert specifically to create diagnostic logs.

trans-unit.source: For example, you could insert calls like this:
trans-unit.target: For example, you could insert calls like this:

trans-unit.source: You can also search logs generated with a logging framework - log4Net, NLog or System.Diagnostics.Trace.
trans-unit.target: You can also search logs generated with a logging framework - log4Net, NLog or System.Diagnostics.Trace.

trans-unit.source: If you plan to use log4Net or NLog, install it in your project.
trans-unit.target: If you plan to use log4Net or NLog, install it in your project.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click your project and choose Manage NuGet Packages.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click your project and choose Manage NuGet Packages.

trans-unit.source: Select Online > All, select Include Prerelease and search for "Microsoft.ApplicationInsights"
trans-unit.target: Select Online > All, select Include Prerelease and search for "Microsoft.ApplicationInsights"

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get the prerelease version of the appropriate adapter</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get the prerelease version of the appropriate adapter</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the appropriate package - one of:
trans-unit.target: Select the appropriate package - one of:

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceListener (to capture System.Diagnostics.Trace calls)
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.TraceListener (to capture System.Diagnostics.Trace calls)

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.NLogTarget
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.NLogTarget

trans-unit.source: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Log4NetAppender
trans-unit.target: Microsoft.ApplicationInsights.Log4NetAppender

trans-unit.source: The NuGet package installs the necessary assemblies, and also modifies web.config or app.config.
trans-unit.target: The NuGet package installs the necessary assemblies, and also modifies web.config or app.config.

trans-unit.source: If you use System.Diagnostics.Trace, a typical call would be:
trans-unit.target: If you use System.Diagnostics.Trace, a typical call would be:

trans-unit.source: If you prefer log4net or NLog:
trans-unit.target: If you prefer log4net or NLog:

trans-unit.source: Run your app in debug mode, or deploy it.
trans-unit.target: Run your app in debug mode, or deploy it.

trans-unit.source: You'll see the messages in Diagnostic Search when you select the Trace filter.
trans-unit.target: You'll see the messages in Diagnostic Search when you select the Trace filter.

trans-unit.source: Getting exception reports in Application Insights provides a very powerful experience, especially since you can navigate between the failed requests and the exceptions, and read the exception stack.
trans-unit.target: Getting exception reports in Application Insights provides a very powerful experience, especially since you can navigate between the failed requests and the exceptions, and read the exception stack.

trans-unit.source: In some cases, you need to <linkText>insert a few lines of code[exceptions]</linkText><title></title> to make sure your exceptions are being caught automatically.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, you need to <linkText>insert a few lines of code[exceptions]</linkText><title></title> to make sure your exceptions are being caught automatically.

trans-unit.source: You can also write explicit code to send exception telemetry:
trans-unit.target: You can also write explicit code to send exception telemetry:

trans-unit.source: JavaScript
trans-unit.target: JavaScript

trans-unit.source: C#
trans-unit.target: C#

trans-unit.source: VB
trans-unit.target: VB

trans-unit.source: The properties and measurements parameters are optional, but are useful for filtering and adding extra information.
trans-unit.target: The properties and measurements parameters are optional, but are useful for filtering and adding extra information.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you have an app that can run several games, you could find all the exception reports related to a particular game.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you have an app that can run several games, you could find all the exception reports related to a particular game.

trans-unit.source: You can add as many items as you like to each dictionary.
trans-unit.target: You can add as many items as you like to each dictionary.

trans-unit.source: You'll see a summary of exceptions reported on the Overview blade, and you can click through to see more details.
trans-unit.target: You'll see a summary of exceptions reported on the Overview blade, and you can click through to see more details.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: <linkText></linkText>[]
trans-unit.target: <linkText></linkText>[]

trans-unit.source: Click on any exception type to see specific occurrences:
trans-unit.target: Click on any exception type to see specific occurrences:

trans-unit.source: <linkText></linkText>[]
trans-unit.target: <linkText></linkText>[]

trans-unit.source: You can also open Diagnostic Search directly, filter on exceptions, and choose the exception type that you want to see.
trans-unit.target: You can also open Diagnostic Search directly, filter on exceptions, and choose the exception type that you want to see.

trans-unit.source: Application Insights reports unhandled exceptions where it can, from devices, <linkText>web browsers[usage]</linkText><title></title>, or web servers, whether instrumented by <linkText>Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Application Insights SDK[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Application Insights reports unhandled exceptions where it can, from devices, <linkText>web browsers[usage]</linkText><title></title>, or web servers, whether instrumented by <linkText>Status Monitor[redfield]</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Application Insights SDK[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: However, it isn't always able to do this in some cases because the .NET framework catches the exceptions.
trans-unit.target: However, it isn't always able to do this in some cases because the .NET framework catches the exceptions.

trans-unit.source: To make sure you see all exceptions, you therefore have to write a small exception handler.
trans-unit.target: To make sure you see all exceptions, you therefore have to write a small exception handler.

trans-unit.source: The best procedure varies with the technology.
trans-unit.target: The best procedure varies with the technology.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Exception telemetry for ASP.NET[exceptions]</linkText><title></title> for details.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Exception telemetry for ASP.NET[exceptions]</linkText><title></title> for details.

trans-unit.source: When you read diagnostic logs, it's likely that your source code will have changed since the live code was deployed.
trans-unit.target: When you read diagnostic logs, it's likely that your source code will have changed since the live code was deployed.

trans-unit.source: It's therefore useful to put build information, such as the URL of the current version, into a property along with each exception or trace.
trans-unit.target: It's therefore useful to put build information, such as the URL of the current version, into a property along with each exception or trace.

trans-unit.source: Instead of adding the property separately to every exception call, you can set the information in the default context.
trans-unit.target: Instead of adding the property separately to every exception call, you can set the information in the default context.

trans-unit.source: In the app initializer such as Global.asax.cs:
trans-unit.target: In the app initializer such as Global.asax.cs:

trans-unit.source: Request telemetry is sent automatically when you <linkText>install Status Monitor on your web server[redfield]</linkText><title></title>, or when you <linkText>add Application Insights to your web project[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Request telemetry is sent automatically when you <linkText>install Status Monitor on your web server[redfield]</linkText><title></title>, or when you <linkText>add Application Insights to your web project[greenbrown]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: It also feeds into the request and response time charts in Metric Explorer and on the Overview page.
trans-unit.target: It also feeds into the request and response time charts in Metric Explorer and on the Overview page.

trans-unit.source: If you want to send additional events, you can use the TrackRequest() API.
trans-unit.target: If you want to send additional events, you can use the TrackRequest() API.

trans-unit.source: Looks like you installed the logging adapter Nuget package without installing Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: Looks like you installed the logging adapter Nuget package without installing Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: In Solution Explorer, right-click ApplicationInsights.config and choose Update Application Insights.
trans-unit.target: In Solution Explorer, right-click ApplicationInsights.config and choose Update Application Insights.

trans-unit.source: You'll get a dialog that invites you to sign in to Azure and either create an Application Insights resource, or re-use an existing one.
trans-unit.target: You'll get a dialog that invites you to sign in to Azure and either create an Application Insights resource, or re-use an existing one.

trans-unit.source: That should fix it.
trans-unit.target: That should fix it.

trans-unit.source: Up to 500 events per second from each application.
trans-unit.target: Up to 500 events per second from each application.

trans-unit.source: Events are retained for seven days.
trans-unit.target: Events are retained for seven days.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set up availability and responsiveness tests[availability]</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set up availability and responsiveness tests[availability]</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.target: <linkText>Troubleshooting[qna]</linkText><title></title>
